docs.lead_paragraph: The Bank of England urged banks on Thursday to consider the risk of future spikes in interest rates when they approve mortgages, and prepared tools to rein in potentially dangerous lending.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. House of Representatives Republicans will unveil a 10-year budget blueprint in the next few weeks that will champion fiscal austerity, a theme party leaders hope will energize conservative voters ahead of the November congressional elections.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said it would grant more time to sign up for health insurance to those people who can prove they began their applications before April 1.

headline.main: U.S. Announces Further Exemptions for Insurance Enrollment Deadline
headline.print_headline: U.S. Announces Further Exemptions for Insurance Enrollment Deadline

docs.abstract: Obama administration expands the list of people who can sign up for health insurance after the deadline, announcing 'special enrollment periods' for legal immigrants, victims of domestic violence and people who experience various problems trying to complete their applications for coverage.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration said it would grant more time to sign up for health insurance to those people who can prove they began their applications before April 1.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama will most likely address income inequality in his meeting on Thursday, a topic with similarities to Francis’ anti-poverty economic agenda.

headline.main: Pontiff and President Seek Common Cause Amid Prickly Issues
headline.print_headline: Pope and President Seek Common Cause Amid Prickly Issues

docs.lead_paragraph: The move, a discharge petition, is intended to spur a House vote on an immigration bill. It would require 218 signatures, but it is rarely successful.

docs.lead_paragraph: Chinese regulators have told the country's two largest insurers to stop selling coverage against smog, a week after such policies were launched, the China Daily reported on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: China Regulators Order End to Smog Insurance Sales

docs.snippet: Chinese regulators have told the country's two largest insurers to stop selling coverage against smog, a week after such policies were launched, the China Daily reported on Thursday.
